The First Principle: The knowledge that every occurrence in the world is His action, His creation, and His invention; there is no creator for it other than Him, and no one brings it into existence except Him. Does He not know who He created? And He is the Subtle, the Aware.' He commanded the servants to be cautious in their statements and their actions, their secrets and their hidden thoughts due to His knowledge of the sources of their actions, and He argued for the knowledge of creation. And how could He not be the creator of the servant's action when His power (Qudrah) is complete with no deficiency in it, and it is connected to the movement of the bodies of the servants, and the movements are similar, and the connection of the power (Qudrah) to them is for their essence. So what is it that restricts its connection from some movements without others despite their similarity? Or how could the animal be independent in invention when there issues from the spider, the bee, and all the animals from subtle crafts what bewilders the intellects of those of understanding? So how did they become isolated in their invention without the Lord of lords, and they are not knowing of the details of what issues from them of acquisition? Far, far be it! The creations have been humbled, and He is unique in sovereignty and dominion, the Compeller of the earth and the heavens.
